com.guardtime.ksi.hashing

Class DataHasher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardtime.ksi.hashing.DataHasher

  • public class DataHasher
extends Object
    Functionality for hashing data.

    Data hasher is stateful, all new data added is added to the same hash calculation, if this class needs to be reused for separate entities, for example hashing multiple files, the reset() method must be called to reset hash calculation.

    Example for hashing a file

     
 // create hasher for default hash algorithm
 DataHasher hasher = new DataHasher();
 // add file to hasher for hashing
 hasher.addFile(new File("test.txt"));
 // get the hash code
 DataHash hash = hasher.getHash();


    Call chaining

    DataHasher addData() functions always return the same hasher so it is possible to chain call to the hasher, if needed.

    For example 
     
 DataHasher hasher = new DataHasher();
 DataHash hash = hasher.addData("Header").addData(bodyBytes).addData(signatureBytes).getHash();

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataHasher()
      Creates new data hasher for the default algorithm (SHA-256).

      Creates new data hasher for specified algorithm.

      • DataHasher

        public DataHasher(HashAlgorithm algorithm)
        Creates new data hasher for specified algorithm.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - HashAlgorithm describing the algorithm to be used in hashing.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when hash algorithm is unknown or the algorithm isn't implemented.
        NullPointerException - when input algorithm is null.

      • DataHasher

        public DataHasher(HashAlgorithm algorithm,
                  boolean checkExpiration)
        Creates new data hasher for specified algorithm.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - HashAlgorithm describing the algorithm to be used in hashing.
        checkExpiration - boolean flag to check, if algorithm is deprecated or obsolete.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when hash algorithm is unknown, isn't implemented, is deprecated or is obsolete.
        NullPointerException - when input algorithm is null.

      • DataHasher

        public DataHasher()
        Creates new data hasher for the default algorithm (SHA-256).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when hash algorithm is unknown or the algorithm isn't implemented.

      • addData

        public final DataHasher addData(byte[] data,
                                int offset,
                                int length)
        Updates the digest using the specified array of bytes, starting at the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        data - the array of bytes.
        offset - the offset to start from in the array of bytes.
        length - the number of bytes to use, starting at the offset.
        Returns:
        The same DataHasher object for chaining calls.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - when hash is already been calculated.

      • getHash

        public final DataHash getHash()
        Gets the final hash value for the digest.

        This will not reset hash calculation.

        Returns:
        hashValue with computed hash value.
        Throws:
        HashException - when exception occurs during hash calculation.

      • reset

        public final DataHasher reset()
        Resets the hash calculation.
        Returns:
        The same DataHasher object for chaining calls.
